customData.content: 52-year-old man presented with a three-month history of cough, appetite loss, and shortness of breath. Performance status was 2 and vital signs were stable.

HPI.summary: 52-year-old man presented with a three-month history of cough, appetite loss, and shortness of breath.

customData.content: CT revealed an ill‐defined soft tissue dense hilar lesion in the right hilum encasing the right main bronchus, right upper lobe bronchus, and middle lobe bronchus. There was collapse of the right middle lobe and encasement of the right descending pulmonary artery. Mediastinal lymph nodes were noted in right upper paratracheal, right lower paratracheal (1 cm in short axis), left lower paratracheal, subcarinal (1.1 cm in short axis) and paraesophageal.

imaging.finding: ill‐defined soft tissue dense hilar lesion
imaging.impression: encasing the right main bronchus, right upper lobe bronchus, and middle lobe bronchus

imaging.finding: collapse of the right middle lobe
encasement of the right descending pulmonary artery

imaging.impression: right upper paratracheal, right lower paratracheal (1 cm in short axis), left lower paratracheal, subcarinal (1.1 cm in short axis) and paraesophageal

customData.content: Bronchoscopy revealed a tumour in the distal right middle lobe measuring 0.5–1 cm from the origin.

procedures.name: Bronchoscopy
procedures.finding: tumour measuring 0.5–1 cm from the origin

imaging.finding: tumour measuring 0.5–1 cm from the origin

customData.content: Histopathological examination (HPE) confirmed adenocarcinoma with a signet ring cell morphology. Immunohistochemistry (IHC) showed positivity for CK 7 and TTF‐1, while synaptophysin was negative.

Whole-body PET-CT scan demonstrated FDG-avid soft tissue lesions with areas of cavitation in the hilum extending into the right middle lobe, causing cutoff of the right middle lobe bronchus and encasement of the right superior pulmonary vein. FDG-avid lymph nodes were observed in the right hilar, right upper paratracheal, and subcarinal regions. Staging revealed cT4b N2M0–STAGE IIIB disease.

imaging.finding: FDG-avid soft tissue lesions with areas of cavitation in the hilum extending into the right middle lobe, causing cutoff of the right middle lobe bronchus and encasement of the right superior pulmonary vein

FDG-avid soft tissue lesions with areas of cavitation in the hilum extending into the right middle lobe, causing cutoff of the right middle lobe bronchus and encasement of the right superior pulmonary vein

customData.content: Multidisciplinary Tumour Board (MDTB) recommended induction chemotherapy followed by chemoradiation.
January 2016: PET-CT after three courses of pemetrexed carboplatin showed poor response. Patient received second-line chemotherapy with cisplatin and docetaxel for four cycles.
April 2016: PET-CT scan revealed progressive disease with pleural effusion, new FDG-avid collapse-consolidation of the right basal segments, and bone metastasis involving the right 5th rib.

imaging.finding: FDG-avid collapse-consolidation of the right basal segments
bone metastasis involving the right 5th rib

data.content: Patient developed an ill‐defined soft tissue dense hilar lesion in the right hilum encasing the right main bronchus, right upper lobe bronchus, and middle lobe bronchus, as well as collapse of the right middle lobe and encasement of the right descending pulmonary artery. Mediastinal lymph nodes were noted in right upper paratracheal, right lower paratracheal (1 cm in short axis), left lower paratracheal, subcarinal (1.1 cm in short axis) and paraesophageal.
Bronchoscopy revealed a tumour in the distal right middle lobe measuring 0.5–1 cm from the origin.
Histopathological examination (HPE) confirmed adenocarcinoma with a signet ring cell morphology. Immunohistochemistry (IHC) showed positivity for CK 7 and TTF‐1, while synaptophysin was negative.

Whole-body PET-CT scan demonstrated FDG-avid soft tissue lesions with areas of cavitation in the hilum extending into the right middle lobe, causing cutoff of the right middle lobe bronchus and encasement of the right superior pulmonary vein. FDG-avid lymph nodes were observed in the right hilar, right upper paratracheal, and subcarinal regions. Staging revealed cT4b N2M0–STAGE IIIB disease.
Multidisciplinary Tumour Board (MDTB) recommended induction chemotherapy followed by chemoradiation.
January 2016: PET-CT after three courses of pemetrexed carboplatin showed poor response. Patient received second-line chemotherapy with cisplatin and docetaxel for four cycles.
April 2016: PET-CT scan revealed progressive disease with pleural effusion, new FDG-avid collapse-consolidation of the right basal segments, and bone metastasis involving the right 5th rib.
